reviews.review_msg: excellent course, enjoyed the project with city studio

Dr. Fourot is extremely knowledgable & passionate about immigration and also wanting to help students learn and succeed. The workload/marking/readings were very fair and lectures were engaging. She went above and beyond to provide accomdations and support, showing great care for all students wellbeing, would 100% recommend her as a prof.

Dr. Fourot is an amazing prof who puts passion into all of her lectures. Readings were mostly light, though some were convoluted and hard to digest. Very fair marker - she assigns multiple written assignments, a midterm, and a final. The written assignments are easy to get through if you pace yourself and are organized. Highly recommend her.

One of the kindest professors I have ever had at SFU. She wants her students to be engaged and she is very respectful of what everyone has to say. Extremely helpful and always goes the extra mile. Super knowledgeable and passionate about immigration.
Excellent course ! Professor Fourot made her possible to make it engaging despite being online. Very caring and flexible, as well.

Professor Fourot was very disorganized the entire semester. Her syllabus made no sense, and nobody knew what was expected of them. Every assignment she assigned required 3-5 follow up questions in lecture just to know what she wanted. I did not know what was testable, and what was additional reading in the course. I get that it was online, but cmon

A really pleasant, kind professor, whose marking structure is *completely* inscrutable. I don't understand the point of deducting .1, .2, etc. marks, especially when the criteria for assignments does not have such precision. Essentially everyone was confused by her grading scheme, though this seems to be a this-semester-specific phenomenon.

Aude-Claire isn't here to mess around - and for that you should be thankful. She knows her material so well and knows to what length you can go to absorb it and use it which might be something you didn't realize you could do yourself. Don't take her feedback personal, DO take the time to see her during her office hours.

she wants you to work for your grade, but that doesn't mean grades are everything to her. she wants you to learn and actually retain information from the course. she wants you to participate and think. she cares about the well-being of her students and won't hesitate to offer extra help outside of the classroom to get you that good grade you want.

I've had one class with Dr. Fourot and she is one of the best professors I've ever had. She cares deeply about her students and the readings and content are always very interesting. She's always good-natured, funny, and clearly brilliant, and she knows her topics amazingly well. She's not an easy marker, but if you put in the time you'll do well.

If you ever read her teaching philosophy, you would know this teacher is a wonderful, wonderful teacher who has a passion in teaching and caring about her students. There are plenty of reading and you are required to understand the week's topic. If not, you will be in trouble for your final exam!! So be prepared!!
Nice, but at times her instructions were confusing.

I took two classes with this prof and I have to say, she is wonderful. There are lots of readings and they are discussed every class, so be prepared. She is very flexible and understanding BUT she does push you! Be prepared to think. The class material is very interesting, and if you are engaged and hardworking, an A is within your reach!
Very helpful in office hours, will go out of her way to help. The classes were always very well structured and engaging......  Occasionally boring (but I did have 3 hour lectures from 3-6pm..)
